text: Allan Eliott-Lockhart (24 January 1803 – 15 March 1878) was a British Conservative politician. Eliott-Lockhart was elected Conservative MP for Selkirkshire at a by-election in 1846—caused by the resignation of Alexander Pringle who had been appointed Clerk of Sasines—and held the seat until 1861, when he resigned by accepting the office of Steward of the Chiltern Hundreds. ==References== ==External links== * Category:Conservative Party (UK) MPs for English constituencies Category:UK MPs 1841–1847 Category:UK MPs 1847–1852 Category:UK MPs 1857–1859 Category:UK MPs 1859–1865 Category:1803 births Category:1878 deaths
title: Allan Eliott-Lockhart
